layerArray.name: Feed The Future: Countries
layerArray.description: Feed the Future is the United States Government's global hunger and food security initiative. It supports country-driven approaches to address the root causes of hunger and poverty and forge long-term solutions to chronic food insecurity and undernutrition.

layerArray.name: Soil Types (HWSD)
layerArray.description: SERVIR Reference Node implementation of the ISIRC, Harmonized World Soil Database (http://www.iiasa.ac.at/Research/LUC/External-World-soil-database/HTML/)

layerArray.name: Ocean Bathymetry (ETOPO1)
layerArray.description: Oceanic surface model (ocean depths), integrated by NOAA/NESDIS from a diverse source of global and regional datasets, 2009. Source: Amante, C. and B. W. Eakins, ETOPO1 1 Arc-Minute Global Relief Model: Procedures, Data Sources and Analysis. NOAA Technical Memorandum NESDIS NGDC-24, 19 pp, March 2009

layerArray.name: Rainfall: 30 min (IMERG)
layerArray.description: Rainfall data (measured in tenths of a millimeter (mm x 10^1)) from the Integrated Multi-satellitE Retrievals (IMERG) for Global Precipitation Mission (GPM). For more information, please reference: http://pmm.nasa.gov/GPM. This IMERG dataset is provided by the NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center's GPM Team and Precipitation Processing System (PPS), which develop and compute IMERG as a contribution to GPM, and archived at the NASA GES DISC.

layerArray.name: Fire - MODIS Hotspots
layerArray.description: FIRMS MODIS data from both Aqua and Terra satellites. FIRMS WMS-T allows you access FIRMS Active Fire Hotspots for a daterange up to 31 days. With WMS-T, you can specifiy a 'TIME' parameter, in the format YYYY-mm-dd (e.g. 2017-03-01/2017-03-31) to obtain fire points for a specific date range.Please note: FIRMS WMS-T currently supports only up to 31 days per request. Also, if there is no data for the specified date, a blank image will be returned.. Also, if there is no data for the specified date, a blank image will be returned.
